text:
Bunch of questions about Pumas:

Deep NLME: is it possible to  consider all the parameters of a NN as random effects?
For regular deep learning you have the universal approximation theorem. Is there something equivalent to this for NLME? You have to approximate a distribution over a function space?
In SciML there is an example of how deep learning can be used to recover a term of the Lotka-Volterra model, by using symbolic regression. Is something like this possible if that term was not a fixed effect, but random?

SDE inference: Are there any plans for parameter estimations specifically for SDE models? Particularly likelihood based methods such as: <https://users.aalto.fi/~asolin/sde-book/sde-book.pdf#section.11.5>
What would currently happen if a use the fit function on a SDE model?

Is there a way to estimate the values a random effect takes for each individual from a population? Particularly methods such as: chapter 16 of <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/243769062_In_All_Likelihood_Statistical_Modelling_and_Inference_Using_Likelihood>

Will experimental design be part of 2.0?

What would currently happen if a use the fit function on a SDE model?

Will experimental design be part of 2.0?

text:
> Deep NLME
Some of my colleagues might be able to give more detailed answers here but generally speaking, I think the intersection between NLMEs and NNs is still mostly unexplored theoretically as well as in practice. We are working on the tools that will allow you to write NN based models in the traditional pharma NLMEs. To some extend, it’s already possible but our plan is to make it easier.

> SDE inference: Are there any plans for parameter estimations specifically for SDE models?
Yes. Likelihood based estimation of SDEs is something that we’d like to support eventually but it’s not within the scope of the 2.0 release which is expected later this month.

Are you studying estimation of SDEs or are you mostly interested in applying such tools?

> What would currently happen if a use the fit function on a SDE model?
As mentioned, it’s not supported yet so it will fail. Possibly with a rather uninformative error message.

> Particularly methods such as: chapter 16
I’d have to take a look and get back to you on that.

> Will experimental design be part of 2.0?
Yes. There will be a first release of optimal design. <@U85JBUGGP> will be able to provide more details.

We are working on the tools that will allow you to write NN based models in the traditional pharma NLMEs. To some extend, it’s already possible but our plan is to make it easier.
SDE inference: Are there any plans for parameter estimations specifically for SDE models?

Yes. Likelihood based estimation of SDEs is something that we’d like to support eventually but it’s not within the scope of the 2.0 release which is expected later this month.

Are you studying estimation of SDEs or are you mostly interested in applying such tools?
What would currently happen if a use the fit function on a SDE model?
As mentioned, it’s not supported yet so it will fail. Possibly with a rather uninformative error message.
I’d have to take a look and get back to you on that.
Will experimental design be part of 2.0?
Yes. There will be a first release of optimal design.
will be able to provide more details.

text: Re: optimal design of experiments, at least sample time optimisation will be part of 2.0.

elements.text: Re: optimal design of experiments, at least sample time optimisation will be part of 2.0.

text: For myself, I am mostly interested in studying experimental design for complicated (biological/chemical) dynamical systems: SDE, missing model terms replaced by a NN... , but I also just do quite a bit of parameter estimation for my colleagues, when their matlab code becomes too slow.
